intro: Galium nigricans var. brachychaetum, commonly known as the short-haired bedstraw, is a flowering plant native to parts of Asia, including China and Japan. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its prostrate or ascending growth habit. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are often hairy, especially on the underside. It typically thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands or along stream banks. This variant is distinguished by its shorter, more compact hairs compared to other varieties of Galium nigricans.
